summary: Email chain between attorneys regarding a grand jury subpoena response for documents related to trusts referenced in prior wills of Jeffrey Epstein. Marc Weinstein sends missing pages of a document to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Marc A. Weinstein
persons.role: Partner, Chair of White Collar Defense at Hughes Hubbard & Reed LLP
persons.context: Attorney representing the executors of Jeffrey Epstein's estate, sending documents in response to a grand jury subpoena.

persons.name: Andrew Tomback
persons.context: Copied on email correspondence regarding the grand jury subpoena response.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: His estate's executors are the target of the grand jury subpoena, and the documents pertain to trusts referenced in his prior wills.

connections.description: Weinstein is acting as legal counsel for the executors of Epstein's estate in responding to a grand jury subpoena.
Both are attorneys copied on the same legal correspondence regarding the grand jury subpoena response.

events.title: Grand jury subpoena response submission
events.description: Marc Weinstein sends documents (Bates al_000406 through al_000459) to the U.S. Attorney's Office in response to a grand jury subpoena issued to the executors of Jeffrey Epstein's estate.

events.title: Follow-up on missing document pages
events.description: An unidentified recipient informs Marc Weinstein that two pages are missing from the previously sent document set, and Weinstein agrees to resend them.

events.title: Missing pages sent
events.description: Marc Weinstein sends the two missing pages from the document 'The JEE 2001 Trust One and First Amendment' to complete the grand jury subpoena response.

events.title: Grand jury subpoenas issued
events.description: Grand jury subpoenas were issued to the executors of Jeffrey Epstein's estate, prompting the document production discussed in this email chain.

events.title: Prior wills of Jeffrey Epstein produced
events.description: Prior wills of Jeffrey Epstein were produced, which referenced trusts that later became the subject of the grand jury subpoena request.

locations: New York, NY 10004-1482 (Hughes Hubbard & Reed LLP office at One Battery Park Plaza)
USANYS (U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York)
keyFacts: A grand jury investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's estate was active as of October 2019 and continued into January 2020.
The subpoena sought documents related to trusts referenced in Epstein's prior wills, indicating a focus on his financial and estate planning structures.
Marc A. Weinstein of Hughes Hubbard & Reed was the lead attorney handling the document production for the estate's executors.
The document references 'The JEE 2001 Trust One and First Amendment,' a specific financial trust associated with Epstein.
Communication shows coordination between private defense attorneys (Weinstein, Tomback) and federal prosecutors (USANYS) in responding to the subpoena.
